translation: The great personality, Lord Nityānanda Prabhu, is free from anger and full of transcendental ecstasy. He wanders throughout the towns, free from false pride and arrogance.

text: adhama patita jīver dvāre dvāre giyā
translation: He travels from door to door to the homes of the fallen souls, freely distributing the Hare Krishna mahāmantra.

text: jāre dekhe tāre kohe dante tṛṇa kori
translation: With straw between His teeth, He begs all who cross his path, “Worship Lord Gaurahari and you will purchase me.”

text: eta boli’ nityānanda bhūme goḍi jāy
translation: Saying this Nityānanda falls to the ground, appearing like a golden mountain rolling in the dust.

text: heno avatāre jāra rati nā janmilo
lochan bole sei pāpī elo āra gelo
translation: Where attachment for such an incarnation has not arisen, Lochan Dās says that such a sinful person comes and goes in the cycle of repeated birth and death.
